definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: This place is close and convenient to the street-car.
Trolleybuses are collected to electric wires.
In summer there were streetcars with open platforms.
sentences.chinese: 夏天，露天站臺上有多輛電車。

sentences.english: When I was halfway there, the streetcar passed me.
sentences.chinese: 當我走到一半的路程時，那輛電車經過了我。

sentences.english: They've been in a very terrible trolley car wrack .
sentences.chinese: 他們在一場嚴重的電車事故中受傷。

sentences.english: The new trolleybus line was routed through the commercial district.
sentences.chinese: 新的無軌電車路線規定要通過商業區。

sentences.english: The trolley bus picks up current from an overhead wire.
sentences.chinese: 電車的電能是通過架空線供給的。

sentences.english: I ride, they call it Muni, but it's the bus system here.
sentences.chinese: 我乘坐這裏人所稱的有軌電車。

sentences.english: The trolleybus connects here with a bus for the airport.
sentences.chinese: 無機電車在這裏與機場的公共汽車連接。

sentences.english: Trams, or electric streetcars, were first introduced in New Zealand in 1905.
sentences.chinese: 有軌電車又叫電車，於1905年被首次引進新西蘭。

sentences.english: Trams, or electric streetcars, were first introduced in New Zealand in 1905.
sentences.chinese: 有軌電車又叫電車，於1905年被首次引進新西蘭。

sentences.english: The 104, also as a brand new trolleybus .
sentences.chinese: 在104，也作爲全新的無軌電車。

sentences.english: What can you see from a tram or a double-decker?
sentences.chinese: 從有軌電車和雙層電車上你能看到什麼？

sentences.english: What can you see from a tram or a double-decker?
sentences.chinese: 從有軌電車和雙層電車上你能看到什麼？

sentences.english: When the driver finally discovered the trolleybus coming towards him through the fog.
sentences.chinese: 當他最後透過霧發現電車向他駛來時。

sentences.english: A similar situation also prevailed in its tram service.
sentences.chinese: 它的有軌電車系統也是相似的情況。

definition: to get off or out of (a bus, train, car etc)
to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
to gallop/speedily/to proceed to/to pilot (ship, plane etc)/to sail
bus/abbr. for 公共汽車|公共汽车[gong1 gong4 qi4 che1]/car belonging to an organization and used by its members (government car, police car, company car etc)/abbr. for 公務用車|公务用车[gong1 wu4 yong4 che1]
